basics.name: Yutian Lei
basics.label: MSc Student in GIScience
basics.summary: MSc candidate in GIS at Wuhan University, with a passion for research and programming

courses: Intelligent Processing and Analysis of Geographic Information

education.institution: Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications

publications.name: MVCF-TMI: A Travel Mode Identification Framework via Contrastive Fusion of Multi-View Trajectory Representations
publications.summary: This paper proposes a novel travel mode identification framework that uses multi-view contrastive learning to align spatial and kinematic features of GPS trajectories in a shared subspace, improving both accuracy and generalization.

projects.name: A Novel Contrastive Fusion Framework for Multi-view Trajectory Features in Travel Mode Identification
projects.summary: Exploited multi-view spatial-temporal features of GPS trajectory to facilitate comprehensive information.

projects.name: A Localization Approach Based on 5G Cellular Signaling Data and Individual Spatio-temporal Behavior
projects.summary: Addressed the industrial challenge of low accuracy in building-level indoor user positioning using 5G data.

projects.name: Open Geospatial Engine (OGE) - a Platform for Earth Observation, Spatial Data Processing and Analysis
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a PostgreSQL database to store global geospatial vector data, including database schemas, partitioning strategies, and table structures with appropriate fields and attributes.

projects.name: A GIS-based Method for Subgrade Compaction Management (BSc. Thesis)
projects.summary: Resolved excessive fragmented data storage issues by leveraging advanced spatial operations.
